meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unable to be compared.
meanings.sent1: The noncomparability of emotions makes it challenging to understand how others feel.
meanings.sent2: The noncomparability of the two paintings made it difficult to determine which one was better.
meanings.sent3: The noncomparability of apples and oranges led to a humorous mix-up at the fruit stand.
meanings.sent4: Her noncomparability to anyone else in the room made her stand out like a rare gem.
meanings.sent5: The noncomparability of the two languages was evident in their unique grammar structures.

meanings.definition: The lack of a basis for comparison.
meanings.sent1: The noncomparability of the new technology with existing models caused confusion among users.
meanings.sent2: The noncomparability of the two datasets made it impossible to draw any meaningful conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The noncomparability of the situation to anything they had experienced before left them feeling lost.
meanings.sent4: The noncomparability of her talent to anyone else's made her a true original in the music industry.
meanings.sent5: The noncomparability of his cooking skills to hers was like night and day, with him burning everything he touched.
